title: Vert.x requires 100-Continue to be enable explicitly
body:
### Describe the bug

When using the RouteBase and Route base implementation of endpoints 100-Continue support is not enable automatically causing clients that explicitly wait for the 100-continue to missbehave.

For example:

```
import io.quarkus.vertx.web.Body;
import io.quarkus.vertx.web.Route;
import io.quarkus.vertx.web.RouteBase;

@RouteBase(path = "/hello")
public class GreetingController {

    @Route(
        path = "upload",
        methods = { Route.HttpMethod.POST },
        type = Route.HandlerType.NORMAL,
        produces = { "text/plain" }
    )
    public String Test(@Body String content) {
        return "Test";
    }
}
```

when uploading larger files via `curl -v -XPOST --expect100-timeout 10` will cause a wait time of 10s after every chunk.
This is cause 100-continue support needs to be explicitly activated in vertx via [setHandle100ContinueAutomatically](https://vertx.io/docs/vertx-core/java/#_100_continue_handling)

### Expected behavior

There should be a configuration option to enable the 100-continue support in vert.x

### Actual behavior

The 100-continue support cannot be activated causing some clients to missbehave

### How to Reproduce?

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create empty project with vert.x support
2. Create Endpoints as described in bug description
3. Send payload via client that expects 100-Continue support (for example curl)
